Reviews.Title: Very nice and easy QC8016 NVR with Q-See IP cameras, but I'm having a problem with motion detection on Onvif 2.0 cameras
Reviews.Author: 1080p fan
Reviews.Content: I'm having a problem configuring "motion detection" recording with this QC8016 NVR and (10) "Private" label Onvif 2.0 cameras I purchased from a Chinese company.  Even though motion detection recording is the QC8016 "default" NVR setting, motion detection recording doesn't work with these cameras.Then I did some research and found that Onvif 2.2 is required on both the NVR and IP Cameras for motion detection to work.  I read that both the NVR and cameras are Onvif 2.0.  I'll update this thread if I find a work-around solution.

Reviews.Title: Takes a lot of time to work out bugs.
Reviews.Author: gsh2x
Reviews.Content: Extremely hard to get to work properly with non-Q-See cameras.  Make sure you contact Q-See support to get latest firmware updates before use.

Reviews.Title: Better than Analog
Reviews.Author: dbrad
Reviews.Content: Excellent product for the price.  I've been installing closed circuit video for over 20 years now.  The recording on this NVR is three time greater than Analog.  Its very simple to setup.  The problems that I have is only 4 POE ports built into the unit and that the front panel has no functions what so ever.  Forget that grainy analog cctv and step up and get great picture quality with this NVR.  The product is sold and backed by Amazon so you cant go wrong
